replies.body: THe only people who hate Leaverbuster are the people it's designed to remove from the game.
so you're telling me to not play the game i love and never play games that are online cooperative games??

I'm not saying never. I'm saying you'll have to accept the consequences of your issues, and accept that Riot have a responsibility to protect other players as well, not just you. Avoid ranked, and take what steps you can to improve your internet, even (or perhaps especially) if that is constantly badgering your ISP telling them you aren't getting the reliable connection you were promised. I know some places in the US don't have options for ISPs, but if it's at all possible, oftentimes a phonecall telling them you're going to take your business elsewhere if they don't resolve the issue is enough.

You might not have control over your ISP of course, but if you can, talk to whoever does. If your connection is as spotty as it sounds you either live pretty far out in the country or someone somewhere is screwing you over (by negligence or otherwise).
I guess one day they will actually implement something like buying your leavebuster to go away. IDK it would prob profit Riot. But then again if you cant wait just start a new account

That would defeat the purpose of a punishment, which is what LeaverBuster is. in the same way they don't let you buy back banned accounts, they aren't going to give players any way to mitigate or remove LeaverBusters.

True but  riot gives people the option to either do those bans queues or make another account. A lot of people would go Option B being to make another account and start from scratch. True it might be a hassle but in the end. Your only option is to never be salty. But a lot of people can't avoid being it ;p 

Only option to do is mute all chat.  That is what I have herd recently

Either way it's a punishment because you lose that time investment. If you can't avoid being salty then let's face it, online games probably aren't ideal for you. At least league has the option to mute everything so you can just play the game without that interaction, which is definitely a good choice if you fall into the salt pile quickly.

Sometimes there really is nothing you can do. If you've already checked your router, connected to ethernet (if at all possible), spoken to your ISP, etc then maybe there isn't anything you can do. What it means is you're one of the very unlucky ones, and it sucks, but at a point you have to accept that your issues ruin the game for 4-9 other people *every* time they occur.

That's a lot of games that you have a negative influence on, even if it isn't intentional. At a point, Riot can no longer shield you from the consequences of that. You get quite a bit of leeway with the initial LeaverBuster, so if your internet issues are so significant that you are constantly being hit, you'll have to accept that online multiplayer cooperative games might not be the best environment for you to play in until something can be done to resolve your internet issues.

You think that's fair for your team? Or fun for the enemy? Not to mention if you're joining 10 minutes late it means remake is failing and leaving those players stuck in a game with an afk. 

Internet issues suck. Not being able to properly play a game you enjoy sucks, but think of the effect you are having on *hundreds* of other players. Do they not deserve some form of compensation? Do they not deserve to be treated fairly and with respect? Why should you be given special consideration over every single one of them?

If there is truly nothing you can do to resolve your connection issues, perhaps it is better you stick to bots, or single player games. Otherwise you will simply have to accept the punishment for negatively impacting the experience of all those other players.
